availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Agnes Dance Day. Father of John J. Day, Candice Day, Oteria Day, George W. Day, and Lewis T. Day. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 145B-146A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 403.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 560.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 118B.
